message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
File #1
```java
public class ViolinGonzalezAP3 {
    //Create Violin class
    public static int numberOfStrings = 4;
    public static char[] stringNames = {'E', 'A', 'D', 'G'};
    public static boolean isTuned = false;
    public static boolean isPlaying = false;
    public static int numberOfViolins = 0;

    public ViolinGonzalezAP3(){
        //Create methods for Violin class
        numberOfViolins++;
    }
    public static void startPlaying() {
        isPlaying = true;
        System.out.println(" violin is now playing.");
    }
    public static void stopPlaying() {
        isPlaying = false;
        System.out.println(" violin has stopped playing.");
    }
    public static void tuneOn() {
        isTuned = true;
        System.out.println(" violin is now tuned.");
    }
    public static void tuneOff() {
        isTuned = false;
        System.out.println(" violin is untuned.");
    }
    public static int getNumberOfViolins(){
        return numberOfViolins;
    }
    public static int getNumberOfStrings(){
        return numberOfStrings;
    }
    public static char[] notes(){
        return stringNames;
    }
}
```
File #2
```java
import java.io.*;
import java.util.Arrays;

public class ViolinDriverGonzalezAP3 {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception{
        //Declare file and class names
        java.io.File file = new java.io.File("Java violinOutput.txt");
        PrintWriter output = new PrintWriter(file);
        ViolinGonzalezAP3[] violinAmount = new ViolinGonzalezAP3[10];
        //Create 10 violin objects
        for (int i = 0; i < violinAmount.length; i++){
            violinAmount[i] = new ViolinGonzalezAP3();
            System.out.println(ViolinGonzalezAP3.getNumberOfViolins() + " Violin");
            output.write(ViolinGonzalezAP3.getNumberOfViolins() + " object:");
            violinAmount[i].tuneOff();
            output.write("The violin is now tunning...");
            violinAmount[i].tuneOn();
            output.write("The violin is now playing...");
            violinAmount[i].startPlaying();
            output.write("String numbers is " + ViolinGonzalezAP3.getNumberOfStrings() + " with String names are " + Arrays.toString(ViolinGonzalezAP3.notes()));
            output.write("The violin is now stopped");
            violinAmount[i].stopPlaying();
        }
        output.close();
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The "cannot resolve" error was due to the fact that the Violin class was defined inside the ViolinGonzalezAP3 class, but was being used in the ViolinDriverGonzalezAP3 class as if it was a standalone class. To fix this, I moved the Violin class methods to the ViolinGonzalezAP3 class and made them static so they can be accessed without creating an instance of the class. In the ViolinDriverGonzalezAP3 class, I replaced all instances of Violin with ViolinGonzalezAP3. I also replaced all instances of PrintWriter.println with PrintWriter.write as per the API requirement.
